walking.fingerprint 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

    Create Grid Data for single subject from raw accelerometry

    create_subject_predictor.Rd

    Create Grid Data for single subject from raw accelerometry

    Usage

    create_subject_predictor(
  data,
  max_signal = 3,
  bin_size = 0.25,
  lags = c(1, 2, 3)
)

    Arguments

    data

    a data.frame with the columns time and vm

    max_signal

    maximum signal of vector magnitude to create grid over, grid will be 0 to max_signal by bin_size

    bin_size

    Size of the bins. max_signal must be evenly divisible by bin_size.

    lags

    the lag (in samples, not seconds) to compute bin inclusion.

    Value

    A data.frame of subject level lags and cut-values

    Examples

    df = example_walking %>%
   dplyr::mutate(time = lubridate::floor_date(Sys.time(), "seconds") + time)
create_subject_predictor(df)
#> # A tibble: 207 × 433
#>    second              `lag_1_[0,0.25]_[0,0.25]` `lag_1_[0,0.25]_(0.25,0.5]`
#>    <dttm>                                  <int>                       <int>
#>  1 2023-10-13 14:22:11                         0                           0

create_subject_predictor(df, lags = c(1, 15))
